trustfund:
TF036016-ECA REGION - WATER AND
            AGRICULTURE (ARMENIA, UZBEKISTAN),TF033283-ECA REGION (LITHUANIA AND
            LATVIA) AGRICULTURE DEV. PROJECTS,TF032683-ARMENIA - IRRIGATION
            REHABILITATION PROJECT,TF032000-ARMENNIA - IRRIGATION REHABILITATION,TF031092-ARMENIA IRRIGATION REHABILITATION

abstracts.cdata!:
The Irrigation Rehabilitation Project is
            considered to have had satisfactory achievement of its
            intended objectives. It has increased and stabilized the
            area receiving irrigation water and had a significant impact
            on water resources management by establishing Water User
            Groups and assisting them to assume responsibility for
            operation and maintenance for the tertiary and on-farm
            levels of the irrigation system. In the early project
            implementation period (1995-97), the major
            "outside" factor which affected project
            implementation was the general underdevelopment of the
            private construction sector. In the latter years of the
            project, the main external factor affecting the outcome was
            the recurrent drought. In broad terms, the main lessons
            learned during the implementation were: a) Using local
            prices for project costing when project preparation takes
            place in a highly inflationary environment should be
            avoided. b) If clients are to be able to respond efficiently
            to the evolving conditions, their financial management
            personnel must have close contact with the design personnel
            as well as with the procurement group. c) In the
            institutional area, importance must be given to
            institutional development as a prerequisite for achieving
            efficiency and sustainability in the development and
            management of irrigation and drainage systems.
